text: it's fall in New England it's that time
of year when the leaves on the trees
turn beautiful shades of red orange and
yellow I thought this was a good time
and place to share these next few
expressions with you the first is to
pass with flying colors this means to do
very well on a test so if you have a
friend who scored high on a test or exam
you can congratulate him or her and say
good job
I heard you passed with flying colors
sometimes you might hear a variation to
come through with flying colors to pass
with flying colors to come through with
flying colors it means the same thing
now you may wonder where this expression
comes from it's connected to sailing
picture a military ship when it sails
home to its port it raises its flags to
show that it was victorious in battle
the next expression is also connected to
sailing
now flags are what identify a ship an
American ship sails under the flag of
the United States and a British ship
sailed under the flag of Great Britain
and a pirate ship sails under that black
flag with the skull and crossbones in
fact it's that pirate ship that from a
distance might appear peaceful and
friendly but when it comes closer and
raises that pirate flag you know it to
be dangerous the expression to show once
true colors means to reveal what you
really like to show your true character
so if you show your true colors you do
something or say something to erase the
initial impression and now you show what
you really like as a person that could
be a good thing or a bad thing the final
expression is also connected to colors
but one specific one red we say to be in
the red to mean to be in debt and if
you're out of debt you're out of the red
to be in the red and out of the red this
expression comes from the days when
bookkeeping was done by hand
and red ink or red pen was used to show
a negative amount so if business was
going bad and the company was losing
money they used red ink to show the
money that was being lost to be in the
red okay let's review those expressions
what's the expression to do very well in
a test pass with flying colors what's
the expression to show what one is
really like as a person show one's true
colors what's the expression to be in
debt Oh more money than what you have in
the red what's the expression to be out
of debt no longer owe money out of the
red
let's try and exercise complete each
statement with one of the new
expressions each expression will be used
only once one read the statement to
yourself and then I'll tell you the
answer
we used to think that our neighbor
across the street was cold and uncaring
but when our house burned down he showed
his true colors by inviting us to stay
in his home too
business is better this month but were
not out of the red yet the company will
need more time to pay back all that it
owes three
Paulo's knowledge of English is very
good and his math skills are excellent
it's not surprising that he passed the
GMAT with flying colors for
Kathy and Bob had to pay high medical
bills this month even with their two
paychecks they are in the red that's all
for now thanks for watching and happy
studies
